column4: Is a 3mb/sec buffered read transfer rate bad for a SATA dvd drive?
And should I be using SDPARM instead of HDPARM?
When I play movies on my Mythbuntu box, sometimes the DVD skips a bit. I think it can't handle it due to current settings
So I wasn't sure if I should be using sdparm or hdparm
check dmesg mesages to see how it gets configured
dmesg | grep ata --> [    3.767298] ata6.00: ATAPI: _NEC DVD_RW ND-3540A, 1.01, max UDMA/33 (in my case)
ata3.00: ATAPI: HL-DT-ST DVD+/-RW GSA-H73N, B103, max UDMA/100
Thats not good is it? 'max UDMA/100'?
Wow! So it's about as good as it's gonna get?
yep i think (there may be other tweakable through hdparm=
Should I use sdparm instead of hdparm?
if you can make some sense of the command ... its man page scares the hell out of me
Is UDMA/133 good for hard drives? They're SATAII.
tht's the maximun it will report ... UDMA settings makes no much sense on a sata drive (they are legacy from pata days)
you can use hdparm on sata drives but the effect is minor sata drives are autoconfigred by the kernel driver to optimun values and there is nothing you can "force" on them
